I think it‚Äôs the perfect size as anything bigger would probably start to feel like you‚Äôre carrying a small tablet in your pocket. Despite its large screen, this is amazingly comfortable to carry in your front or back pocket, and you hardly know it‚Äôs there.I‚Äôve been using this UMIDIGI G9 5G Cell Phone for about a month now and it is the perfect daily driver. The processor is a solid Unisoc T765 Octa (eight) Core Processor that has 2 large 2.3 GHz Cortex-A73 cores and 6 smaller 2.1 GHz A55 cores on-board. It's a mid-level processor which provides very smooth computing whether your playing, communicating, creating or multitasking, and provides all the power the average user needs.The UMIDIGI G9 has 6GB of installed RAM. This is sufficient for most average users, in fact it's probably lots. If you noticed it comes with 12GB in the description, this is because Android 14 has a Memory Expansion option. It uses an equal amount of your storage space (ROM) as RAM. Now if you know don't know anything about RAM vs ROM (storage) speeds, RAM is almost instantaneous where storage is slower in comparison. However, if a memory-intensive app pushes your 6GB of ram, the expanded ram will jump in and allow your app to continue. I have not yet had a ram issue or a frozen app, whether using the unexpanded 6GB or the expanded 12GB.The G9 comes with 128 GB ROM storage. I consider myself to be an average to intermediate user and I'm currently using about 45 GB or about 1/3 of my storage. This includes 15GB in apps, 8GB of video and audio, 2GB of pictures, and don't forget, the first 13GB is required for your Android 14 operating system.The UMIDIGI G9 comes with dual sim card slots. One slot is a dedicated sim card slot and the other will accept either a second sim or a micro-SD card (up to 1TB). If you don't need more storage, the second sim slot can allow you to carry two phone numbers, like a work number and a personal number, on the same device. This is much better than having to carry two devices.The 5000mAh battery is lasting me about two days on a charge at a low, but comfortable, brightness level. However, I usually charge my phone every night, so I evaluated it during an 18-hour period. On FULL brightness, the G9 had 29% battery; at half, the device had 38% left; and at minimum brightness, the phone held 50% battery life after the full day.The only issue I have with this phone is that it does not come with NFC. This is the feature that allows you to tap your phone to pay with your Debit or Credit card. This is not something I use, but I know many users do. I think in these technological times, TAP should always be standard.If you want a worry-free, large-screen, smooth and reliable cell phone that won't let you down or break the bank, consider the UMIDIGI G9 5G. I chose the GREEN and I really LOVE the colour. It even comes with an installed screen protector and a FREE basic case.

Read more"}, {'Reviewer Name': 'Miss Louise Balmforth', 'Rating': 'N/A', 'Title': 'N/A', 'Date': 'Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 September 2024', 'Review Body': 'The time had come where my galaxy s9 had to be on charge all the time and the battery was lasting maybe 4 hours if I used the screen at all, it had to go..A while back I got a Note 11 for a friend who wanted a cheap phone that would let her use messengers and browse faceache for the same reason, dead battery in her phone, and she raved about how long the battery lasted so I decided to try the note 13 pro.I must say at the start I used UAD-NG to debloat it, there is a lot of crap pre installed that you dont need or want which will all use battery, 136 pieces of it! I would strongly advise you google UAD-NG and clean it out ;)Anyway.. Battery life.. I am not a heavy user, mostly messaging, discord etc, and a bit of browsing, and I am running at about 52 minutes per 1% of battery! Thats pretty good for me!The camera is not amazing, I am a photographer so I dont expect any phone cam to be, I use my DSLR for photography and like probably 99% of people the phone camera is used for nothing more than snaps that are shared over messengers and faceache etc, for that purpose the camera is way more than adequate, its has 4 zoom levels and of course pinch and zoom right in.. even zoomed fully the images are good enough for the typical use. No complaints from me.The audio quality (speaker) is a bit lacking, but again its a ¬£240 smart phone not a ¬£1200 samsung, its not TERRIBLE but I have definitely heard better, and with headphones the sound is fine for my non hifi snobby ears, and who really listens to music without headphones anyway?The fingerprint reader appears to be on the ball, not had any failures, and its fast!.. the face recognition even faster, thats pretty much instant if you unlock the phone with face in view of the cam.***MEMORY*** there is information in the answers here that it does not have an sd card slot, well when I went to put in my sim there is an sd card space in the carrier and when I drop my 256gb sd in that the phone has all my photos and music on it and it tells me that there is a 256gb sd card installed and available, so I think that answer is not entirely correct :D I am quite happy I have 768gb now instead of the 512gb I thought I was getting XDAll in all its definitely a good value for money purchase, I can speak for the longevity of course, but I have had no issues with anything as yet. Its not as polished as a galaxy of course, but its polished enough for me, it does everything I need it to do, the battery life is good, and it is a fraction of the cost of the big boys flagships. I am more than happy I broke away from the big names.

I got used to how to use it and make sure it doesn't swivel while drawing, and it's great to be able to adjust the angle. Il sensore di luminosit√† √® reattivo e ben tarato, cos√¨ come l'accelerometro e il sensore di prossimit√† che funziona bene in chiamata e anche con app per accendere/sbloccare lo schermo senza passare dal tasto fisico.Il touchscreen √® anch'esso ben calibrato e preciso e difficilmente perde un tocco.L'interfaccia proprietaria Doke OS 2.1, basata su Android 11, si presenta semplice, leggera, intuitiva e oltre alle solite app di Google, offre:- il trasferimento dei dati personali da e verso un altro dispositivo;- un gestore di sistema con cui pulire la memoria, ottimizzare i consumi, e controllare vari settaggi delle app;- la modalit√† bambino che fungendo da parental control, limita il tempo di utilizzo dello smartphone, l'uso delle app e dei dati;- il "congelatore" per ibernare le app che si usano meno o che magari tendono a restare in background, risparmiando cos√¨ batteria.Non ci sono bloatware e ancora meno pubblicit√† di alcun genere.Non mancano altre funzioni secondarie come: la luminosit√† notturna per non affaticare la vista al buio, la modalit√† a una mano indicata prima, registrare la schermata o fare screenshot, la possibilit√† di splittare lo schermo, registrare la conversazione durante la chiamata, la navigazione tramite gesti.La ricezione del segnale √® buona, in chiamata si sente bene, la navigazione in 4g non d√† problemi, wi-fi, bluetooth e audio funzionano ugualmente bene.Se la cpu quad-core in fase di acquisto mi era sembrata una delle parti maggiormente di compromesso per contenere il prezzo, in realt√† mi sono dovuto ricredere perch√© pur senza eccessi, senza effetti wow, fa comunque girare bene e in modo abbastanza fluido tutto il sistema, senza grossi impuntamenti o blocchi critici, senza dare problemi nel normale utilizzo quotidiano. E con la gpu e i 3gb di ram, permette di giocare anche a giochi complessi come Real Racing 3, PES 2021, PUBG Mobile, simulatori di guida, senza avere necessariamente proprio tutti i dettagli al minimo.Ci√≤ vale anche per le fotocamere, infatti vanno  bene per gli usi pi√π comuni: dai selfie (ci sono alcuni filtri bellezza e l'IA per migliorare i volti e le foto), alle foto da postare sui social o per catturare dettagli, prendere appunti e scansionare documenti.Lo sblocco dello schermo tramite riconoscimento facciale funziona perfettamente, e grazie alla luminosit√† del display, anche al buio.Lo spazio di archiviazione da 16GB √® sufficiente per le app principali (browser, social, messaggistica) e qualche gioco, col supporto dei cloud per foto e altri media. In alternativa pu√≤ essere esteso tramite microSD. Io ne avevo gi√† acquistato una preventivamente e devo ammettere che lo smartphone continua a  funzionare perfettamente senza rallentamenti, anche con quasi 200 app installate (ho voluto testare molti giochi).La batteria non ha ancora molti cicli di ricarica ma ha gi√† una buona autonomia; sono riuscito a giocare per oltre 5 ore con una sola carica (giochi vari, wi-fi e luminosit√† al 50%), con usi pi√π blandi ho fatto pi√π di 7 ore di schermo acceso. La carica partendo dal 5% impiega circa 4 ore per raggiungere il 100%.√à per tutto quanto ho indicato qui sopra che mi ritengo molto soddisfatto e contento di aver preso un buon smartphone e aver speso poco.
